definition: mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
to escape/to run away/to flee
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Throw our beehive and we'll save you.
sentences.chinese: 我们报恩的时候到了，扔出蜂巢你就能死里逃生。

sentences.english: No one thought that Cagliari could have been saved seven days before the end.
sentences.chinese: 结束前七天没有人认为卡利亚里将是死里逃生的那个。

sentences.english: Although barely escape one's life however disaster and Chi Yu, bear the compensation of price having a day.
sentences.chinese: 虽死里逃生却殃及池鱼，背负起天价的赔偿。

sentences.english: The sailors cheated death in the stormy seas.
sentences.chinese: 海员们从狂风暴雨的大海中死里逃生。

sentences.english: He had been saved from death as if by divine intervention.
sentences.chinese: 他得以死里逃生似有神助。

sentences.english: Later, Rose came out of the shipwreck alive.
sentences.chinese: 后来，罗丝从沉船的灾难中死里逃生。

sentences.english: He escaped from the World Trade Center before it collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 他在世界贸易大厦倒塌前一刻死里逃生。

sentences.english: The matador had a narrow escape.
sentences.chinese: 这个斗牛士真是死里逃生。

sentences.english: Thus I escaped with bare life, coming back from the door of death.
sentences.chinese: 我于是死里逃生，从阴阳界上又转了回来。

sentences.english: Those who have brains and courage come through all right.
sentences.chinese: 有胆有识的人死里逃生。

sentences.english: A survivor of the Western business passenger fled from the desert to oasis.
sentences.chinese: 一个死里逃生的西域商客从沙漠中逃到绿洲。

definition: to just escape from calamity
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
luckily/by a fluke
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
to rescue/to be rescued
to return alive/to survive
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: great catastrophe
